intro: Nephrolepis hirsutula var. ensifolia, commonly known as the sword fern, is a variant of the common nephrolepis characterized by its elongated, sword-shaped fronds. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant features a rhizomatous growth habit, with fronds that can grow up to 1 meter in length. Its leaves are bi- or tri-pinnate, with a leathery texture and a dark green coloration. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens and indoor settings.
